thread.title: 'Hillary for Prison' sign spotted at Trump rally
thread.title_full: 'Hillary for Prison' sign spotted at Trump rally | Washington Examiner

author: Daniel Chaitin
title: 'Hillary for Prison' sign spotted at Trump rally
text:
For some, the campaign season isn't over just yet.
As President Trump and wife, first lady Melania Trump, took the stage at a rally in Melbourne, Fla., Saturday evening, a member of the audience behind the stage could be seen holding up a "Hillary for Prison" sign — spotted by CBS News White House correspondent Mark Knoller. The sign is a reference to Trump's presidential opponent, Hillary Clinton .
At one point, as Trump worked the crowd before speaking, he seemed to spot the sign and point to the person holding it.
Just like the 2016 campaign. Supporter holds sign about Candidate Trump's opponent. pic.twitter.com/E6vE6g7sbl — Mark Knoller (@markknoller) February 18, 2017 
Stay abreast of the latest developments from nation's capital and beyond with curated News Alerts from the Washington Examiner news desk and delivered to your inbox.
  Washington Examiner News Alerts.   alert soon! Throughout his campaign, Trump pledged to pursue legal action against Clinton for using an unauthorized email server while serving as secretary of state.
"Lock her up" became a common chant at Trump rallies during the campaign.
But once elected, Trump changed his tune, telling supporters at a "Thank you" tour rally in Grand Rapids, Mich., that the chant "plays great before the election — now we don't care, right?"
